metadata.name: (▀¯▀) fake news (▀¯▀)
metadata.description:
6560x5248px @ 300 DPI.

This image is part of the "How to kill time?" collection, where I debate and consider that time is no more than an illusion we created to
maintain certain control and order in society, and so controlling our own lives.

Don't you ever feel like you're everyday walking around the same fake and possy social media perception of reality? 
Social media might be thought as a medium to sharing experiences, having a good laugh or even connecting with people all over the world. That's awesome. But is that all? Aren't you trapped into a forced standard that leads into massive control?

Maybe social media is a social-scoring system we impose onto ourselves that makes possible the complete biopolitical surveillance and control of the population. No aspect of your life remains unobserved. Each click, each purchase, each activity on social media is subject to surveillance. This is what makes us so vulnerable to fake news, leading into separation, social gap and even war.
